document_data.name: ''Sword of Savras''
document_data.creator: [[Savras]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Sword of Savras''''' was a magical [[flying sword|flying longsword]] that roamed [[Faerûn]] since the mid-15{{th}} century [[DR]], attacking [[spellcaster]]s seemingly at random.{{Cite dragon/417/Eye on the Realms: The Sword of Spells|24-27}}
document_data.Description: The ''Sword of Savras'' looked like a regular [[longsword]] made of plain metal, with a worn leather grip. When striking its targets, the sword would flare with bright blue light.{{Cite dragon/417/Eye on the Realms: The Sword of Spells|25}}
document_data.Behavior: The Sword of Spells only attacked victims capable of wielding [[arcane magic]], and ignored any other creature. While no pattern could be discerned as how it choose its victims, it attacked very few [[warlock]]s and never targeted any [[Chosen of Mystra]].<ref name="drag417-p25/>
document_data.History:
The ''Sword of Savras'' was created by [[Savras|the eponymous deity]] before its fight with [[Azuth]]. The sword originally healed any damage it caused upon withdrawal, and was intended by the deity as a mean to reward [[Church of Savras|its worshipers]] with new and interesting magic. Used during the battle which opposed its creator against the ascending Lord of Spells, it suffered a volley of magic which damaged it and stripped it of its healing powers.{{Cite dragon/417/Eye on the Realms: The Sword of Spells|25-26}}

Encaged in a magic ''[[forcecage]]'' by Azuth, the sword reappeared during the {{yearlinkName|1449}}, probably due to a weakening of its prison. It started attacking people with regularity until the {{yearlinkName|1454}}, when it vanished for several months. After its reappearance later this year, [[Elminster]] managed to capture the sword and study it for a while.
document_data.Reputation: As the cause of the sword's existence was unknown before Elminster got a chance to study it, rumors abounded regarding its purpose. Some believed the artifact was created by [[Asmodeus]], while others imagined it was the work of [[Szass Tam]] trying to weaken his competition.{{Cite dragon/417/Eye on the Realms: The Sword of Spells|25}}
